extra.enrollment_requirement: Exclusion    No more than 3.0 units from IDIS220; IDIS222.

basic.description:
Students will investigate the process of translating a text from print to digital form and how understandings of textuality, textual materiality, and readership aid in theorising this process. Students will be introduced to basic elements of the standard humanities mark-up language, TEIP5 in order to better enable them to understand this process.
NOTE    This course will only be offered at the BISC.
basic.subject: IDIS
basic.title: Digital Humanities II: The Theory and Practice of Digital Representation
